reviewText:
Because its informative and a real good filmed documentary, with a no nonsense comment and review.
So just as we wanted
Great pricing. Nice video. This is a very good documentary of the Atocha and the Treasure Salvors crew and the Mel Fisher family.

This tells the years-long story of the Mel Fisher family as they searched the ocean floor for a ship reportedly loaded with treasure from the 1600's. After some initial success there is a long gap of time between finding more contents of the hold. During that time the state of Florida and then the Federal Government both state that they should get a portion of the find!

Engaging and insightful along with some sadness along the way.

Check out how the various government entities let the private citizens take all the risk and expense and then step in and try to take the booty for themselves without doing anything to help along the way. Thank goodness for the five justices on the U.S. Supreme Court who can see through the legal gobbledy-gook to the big picture and do the right thing. This is the dream everyone has as a kid of finding treasure chests full of gold and silver. Kudos to Mel Fisher and his crew for painstakingly preserving the historical artifacts for the public, too.
Love the movie.  Just spent some time in the keys and wanted to learn more about the Atocha.
was more than interesting, you can see it repeated times and still get something new with each time watched.
Good book. Great pictures. Fascinating story.
Was exactly as described and shown. Was in excellent condition. My husband loved it!!!
Seems more of a biography of hardships faced by the hunter than a documentary on the ship or details on its recovery
It was very informative as well as entertaining. Learned a lot about the members of the salvage team  Found out a lot of things that never knew
I love the fact Mel Fisher had a dream and he would not be discouraged.  Heart ache and triumph.  What an encouraging story for those of us who dream.
